CATEGORY.name: X&ML construction
CATEGORY.ITEM: The first processing instruction: XML declaration <?xml version="1.0" encoding="windows-1252"?>

Empty comment construction
<!-- -->
Instruction how to view the document <?xmlstylesheet href="" type="text/xslt"?>

CATEGORY.name: X&SL tag
CATEGORY.ITEM: Defines a new template for using by name or node matching <xsl:template match=""> </xsl:template>
Uses all appropriate for current node templates <xsl:apply-templates select=""/>
Invokes a template by name <xsl:call-template name=""/>
Describes a template parameter <xsl:param name="" select=""/>
Sets the value to template parameter <xsl:with-param name="" select=""/>
Declares a local or global variable and gives it a value <xsl:variable name="" select=""> </xsl:variable>
Inserts the value from the selected XML node to the current template position <xsl:value-of select=""/>
Repeats its content for each selected XML node <xsl:for-each select=""> </xsl:for-each>
Defines a sort key, to specify the order in which selected nodes are processed <xsl:sort select="string(.)" order="ascending"/>
Declares a named key, for use with the key() function <xsl:key name="" match="" use=""/>

Inserts subtrees and result-tree fragments into the result tree
<xsl:copy-of select=""/>
Copies the current XML node exactly to the output <xsl:copy></xsl:copy>
Creates new element with the specified name <xsl:element name=""></xsl:element>
Creates new attribute in the parent element <xsl:attribute name=""></xsl:attribute>
Puts contained text to the output <xsl:text></xsl:text>
Puts contained text of this tag to the output as a comment <xsl:comment> </xsl:comment>
Formats a number for output <xsl:number value="" format=""/>
Counts items by given condition <xsl:number level="any" count="" from=""/>
Produces content only if condition is true <xsl:if test=""> </xsl:if>
Produces only one of several fragment by 'when' conditions <xsl:choose> </xsl:choose>
Provides 'one of' content fragment by condition <xsl:when test=""> </xsl:when>
Produces content fragment by default <xsl:otherwise> </xsl:otherwise>
Complex choose structure <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test=""></xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise></xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose>
Specifies how the result tree will be output <xsl:output method="xml" encoding="iso-8859-1"/>
Includes the contents of one stylesheet module within another <xsl:include href=""/>
Imports the contents of one stylesheet module into another <xsl:import href=""/>
Apply functionality from imported module <xsl:apply-imports href=""/>

CATEGORY.name: &Namespaces
CATEGORY.ITEM: Worked Draft XSL namespace "http://www.w3.org/TR/WD-xsl"
Transform (XSLT) namespace "http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"
"urn:schemas-microsoft-com:datatypes"

CATEGORY.name: &HTML
CATEGORY.ITEM: Insert an empty table skeleton

Insert an empty select skeleton
<SELECT size="1"> <OPTION value=""> </OPTION> </SELECT>
Insert an empty list skeleton

Insert an empty HTML page skeleton
<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE></TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY>
</BODY> </HTML>

CATEGORY.name: &Functions
CATEGORY.ITEM: Returns the number of nodes in the node-set argument. count(node-set)
Retrieves other XML resources beyond the initial XML data. document(object node-set?)
Selects elements by their unique ID. id(object)
Retrieves elements previously marked with an xsl:key statement. key(name value)
Returns a number equal to context size of the expression evaluation context. last()
Returns the local part of the expanded name of the node local-name(node-set?)
Returns a string containing a QName representing the expanded name of the node name(node-set?)
Returns the namespace URI of the expanded name of the node namespace-uri(node-set?)
Returns the index number of the node within the parent. position()
Returns the concatenation of the arguments. concat(string string string*)
Returns True if the first argument string contains the second argument string contains(string string)
Returns True if the first argument string starts with the second argument string starts-with(string string)
Returns the argument string with the white space stripped. normalize_space(string)
Converts an object to a string. string(object?)
Returns the number of characters in the string. string-length(string)
Substring of the 1st argument at the position and length substring(string number number?)
Substring of the 1st argument that follows the first occurrence of the 2nd string substring-after(string string)
Substring of the 1st argument string before the first occurrence of the 2nd string substring-before(string string)
Returns replaced characters of the string by translate(string string string)
Converts the argument to a Boolean. boolean(object)
Returns False. false()
True if the xml:lang attribute of the node is the same as the argument string. lang(string)
Returns True if the argument is false, and a false otherwise. not(boolean)
Returns True. true()
Returns the smallest integer that is not less than the argument. ceiling(number)
Returns the largest integer that is not greater than the argument. floor(number)
Converts the argument to a number. number(object?)
Returns an integer closest in value to the argument. round(number)
Returns the sum of all nodes (converted to a num) in the node set. sum(node-set)

CATEGORY.name: &Axis
CATEGORY.ITEM: The parent of the context node and the parent's parent and so on ancestor::
The context node and the ancestors of the context node ancestor-or-self::
Attributes of the context element-type node attribute::
Children of the context node child::
Child or a child of a child and so on descendant::
The context node and the descendants descendant-or-self::
All nodes after the context node with their children following::
Nodes after the context node on the same level following-sibling::
Parent (if there is one) of the context node parent::
All nodes before the context node with their children preceding::
Nodes before the context node on the same level preceding-sibling::
The context node itself self::
